author: Reuters Editorial
title: Russian bank VTB says new capital requirement will cost 140 billion rubles
text:
MOSCOW (Reuters) - The head of Russian bank VTB ( VTBR.MM ) said on Wednesday that complying with new capital requirements set by the central bank and effective from 2019 will cost the state-owned lender 140 billion rubles ($2.24 billion).
FILE PHOTO: A police officer stands guard near a sign with the logo of the Russian lender VTB at the Moscow International Business Centre also known as "Moskva-City" in Moscow, Russia November 21, 2017. REUTERS/Maxim Shemetov CEO Andrei Kostin did not say whether this was an annual cost or a one-off expense.
Reporting by Tatiana Voronova; Writing by Andrey Ostroukh; Editing by David Goodman
